item_list.item_description: Restores a small amount of health.
Restores a moderate amount of health.
Fully restores health.
Fully restores your health and stamina.
A cure for poison/venom.
Removes all traces of poison and restores a slight amount of health.
Mysterious berry that cures blights and resistance down.

quest_rewards.quest_name: H★1 Jumped in the Frost Islands
H★1 No Cure for the Common Baggi

item_list.item_description: Immediately removes any foam or webbing on your body.
An item that cures Stench, hellfireblight, and blast- blight when thrown down.
A Guild-approved beverage that boosts your stamina. Helps shake off sleep, too!
Food that restores a bit of stamina.
Provides a moderate boost to your stamina. This one's still red in the middle.
Food that fully restores stamina.
Meat that has been burnt to a crisp. It might boost your stamina, or drain it...
Boosts your natural ability to heal.
Reduces stamina depletion for a period of time as well as restoring a bit of stamina.
Temporarily strengthens your attacks when ingested by improving energy flow.

quest_rewards.quest_name: V★4 So Hot, It Melts Iron
H★7 Can't Kill It with Fire

item_list.item_description: Boosts your attack power by filling you with—guess what?—demonic strength.
Boosts your attack power even more than a regular Demondrug.
Temporarily raises your defense when ingested by hardening tissue.
Boosts your defense by turning your skin as hard as rock.
Boosts your defense even more than a regular armorskin.
Produces a cloud that heals you and anyone nearby.
Produces a cloud that restores a large amount of health for you and anyone nearby.
Produces a cloud that cures poison and heals you a bit.
A mysterious powder; when dispersed, temporarily strengthens attacks.
A mysterious powder; when dispersed, temporarily strengthens defense.
Flashes brightly on impact. Toss this right under a monster's nose to blind it.
A hand-thrown bomb that emits a high-frequency blast of sound on detonation.
A particularly odorous ball that causes monsters to flee.
A bomb used to capture monsters ensnared in traps. Can be used in various ways.
Releases a toxic cloud of mist when used. Also popular as a household bug bomb.
Instantly transports you to the nearest camp. Can also be used during battles.
Just what you need to cook meat. A must-have item for any hungry hunter.
A standard-sized whetstone. Use it to restore a weapon's sharpness.
A standard throwing kunai. Flies straight and true. Allows for precise aiming.
Meat carved from a monster. You might catch a certain Flooded Forest fish with it.
Raw meat that poisons whatever eats it. Makes great bait for traps.
Raw meat that paralyzes whatever eats it. Makes great bait for traps.
Raw meat that puts whatever eats it to sleep. Makes great bait for traps.
A dangerous substance that explodes when struck or heated.
A small, empty barrel.
A small time bomb.
A large, empty barrel. Combine with gunpowder to make it into a bomb.
A powerful bomb triggered by external physical impact.
An upgraded large barrel bomb. Effective against large monsters.
A lightweight and extremely strong plant. Used to make nets for pitfall traps.
A very sticky web. Used to craft pitfall traps.
A hardy net that can support weight without breaking. Perfect for pitfall traps.
A must-have item for putting together pitfall traps and other kinds of traps.
A trap for catching certain large monsters. It is tripped by a heavy weight.
A trap that immobilizes a target. Use it to capture monsters.
A fatty fish that can restore a small amount of health.
Recovers the red portion of the Health Gauge and increases natural recovery.
A fish with a dorsal fin hard enough to be used to sharpen weapons.
A jumbo-sized Whetfish. Its dorsal fin surpasses even whetstones in functionality.
A fish that eats anything— allowing you to sometimes get items from its stomach.
An enormous Gastronome Tuna. Will eat anything, no matter the size.
An amulet that strengthens attacks. Just carrying this gives you demonic strength.
A charm that strengthens attacks. Its effects are boosted by the claws within.
An amulet that increases defense. Just carrying this makes your skin stone hard.
A charm that strengthens defense. Its effects are boosted by the claws within.
Works with other materials to enhance their effects. Cannot be used by itself.
Highly nutritious honey. Combine with potions to make the more potent mega potion.

quest_rewards.quest_name: V★2 Case of the Creepy Crawlies

item_list.item_description: A primary ingredient in potions.

quest_rewards.quest_name: V★2 Case of the Creepy Crawlies

item_list.item_description: A primary ingredient in antidotes.
A wondrous, flammable plant. Useful for crafting explosives and Flaming Ammo.
This plant's leaves store ample water. A component for making Water Ammo.
A plant that radiates ice- cold air. Combine with other items to create Freeze Ammo.

quest_rewards.quest_name: H★1 Jumped in the Frost Islands
H★1 No Cure for the Common Baggi

item_list.item_description: A plant containing sleeping agents. Used to craft tranquilizers.

quest_rewards.quest_name: H★1 Jumped in the Frost Islands
H★1 No Cure for the Common Baggi

item_list.item_description: A strange and fragrant herb that grows in the shade. Used to make deodorant.
An herb that wilts under the sun's rays. Could it hold healing powers?
A Melynx's favorite food— they just have to steal it.
A mushroom infused with power-enhancing effects. Used in restorative items.

quest_rewards.quest_name: V★2 Case of the Creepy Crawlies

item_list.item_description: A dangerous fungus said to draw the life out of people. Required to make max potions.

quest_rewards.quest_name: V★4 So Hot, It Melts Iron
H★7 Can't Kill It with Fire

item_list.item_description: A hard-to-find mushroom that can generate blazing heat. Required to craft gunpowder.
A mushroom that induces poison. Required to craft poison smoke bombs.
A mushroom that induces paralysis. Required to craft tranq bombs.

quest_rewards.quest_name: V★2 Case of the Creepy Crawlies

item_list.item_description: Has a very strange aroma. Is it edible? Is it deadly? Required to make farcasters.
A bug with innate healing abilities. Used as a component of many medicines.

quest_rewards.quest_name: V★2 Case of the Creepy Crawlies

item_list.item_description: An insect said to live a millennium. Combine it with other items to add their properties to the powder.

quest_rewards.quest_name: V★4 So Hot, It Melts Iron
H★7 Can't Kill It with Fire

item_list.item_description: An insect that sparks when hit. Required to make Shock Traps and Thunder Ammo.
An insect that emits a blinding flash when it dies. Required to make Flash Bombs.

quest_rewards.quest_name: H★1 Jumped in the Frost Islands
H★1 No Cure for the Common Baggi

item_list.item_description: A shrapnel-spewing fish. Mix with a large barrel bomb for a dramatic firepower boost.
A fish that literally pops when it dies. Required to craft cleanser.
Exactly as stated. Exudes a pungent smell. Used to make dung bombs.
A nut that produces torrents of smoke. Combine with other items to add more effects.
A nut that bears a spiral groove. Used to make Pierce Ammo.
A nut covered in needle-like spines. Used to make Spread Ammo.
A nut with a rock-hard shell. Used to make Shrapnel Ammo.
A nut used to make Sticky Ammo.
A nut that ruptures on impact. Used to make cluster bombs.
A mysterious berry, thought to be loathed by dragons. Needed to make Dragon Ammo.

quest_rewards.quest_name: V★4 So Hot, It Melts Iron
H★7 Can't Kill It with Fire

item_list.item_description: Used to make Slicing Ammo.
A nut that explodes on impact. Used to make Wyvern Ammo.
Combustible powder. Combine with level 1 ammo to raise its level.
Used to make gunpowder that increases ammo firepower.
A fish that ignites upon death. Mix with fire herbs to make gunpowder.
A jumbo-sized Combustuna. Mix with fire herbs to get lots of gunpowder.
Highly combustible powder. Combine with level 1 ammo to raise its level.
Used to make gunpowder that greatly increases ammo firepower.
A fish that ignites upon death. Mix with fire herbs to make quality gunpowder.
A jumbo-sized Flamefin. Mix with fire herbs to make lots of quality gunpowder.
Ammo for novices. Doesn't pack much oomph. Unlimited shots.
Non-specialized ammo. More powerful than Normal Ammo 1.
High-quality gunpowder ammo. Single-shot, but fast and impactful.
Armor-piercing ammo that deals multiple hits to some monsters.
High-grade armor-piercing ammo. Deals more hits than Pierce Ammo 1.
Max-grade armor-piercing ammo. Deals numerous hits.
Ammo made for close combat. What it lacks in range, it makes up for in damage.
Ammo made for close combat. Deals more hits than Spread Ammo 1.
Max-grade ammo made for close combat. Deals numerous hits.
Ammo that covers a wide area. Who needs accuracy when you hit this much?
Ammo that covers a wide area. More range and even more hits than Shrapnel Ammo 1.
Max-grade shrapnel ammo that delivers maximum range and hit-count over a wide area.
Powerful pierce and burst ammo. Headshots may stun.
Very powerful pierce and burst ammo. Headshots may stun.
Powerful pierce and burst ammo. Headshots stun.
Ammo that fragments into three shells upon impact. Beware of friendly fire!
Ammo that fragments into four shells upon impact. Beware of friendly fire!
Ammo that fragments into five shells upon impact. Beware of friendly fire!
Ammo that packs a punch against monsters weak to fire element.
Piercing ammo that discharges multiple heavy-hitting fire-element shots.
Ammo that packs a punch against monsters weak to water element.
Piercing ammo that discharges multiple heavy-hitting water-element shots.
Ammo that packs a punch against monsters weak to thunder element.
Piercing ammo that discharges multiple heavy-hitting thunder-element shots.
Ammo that packs a punch against monsters weak to ice element.
Piercing ammo that discharges multiple heavy-hitting ice-element shots.
Ammo that packs a punch against monsters weak to dragon element.
Piercing ammo that discharges multiple heavy-hitting dragon-element shots.
Ammo that ejects sharp blades on impact, which can sever tails.
Ammo created through years of research into Wyvern's Fire.
Poisons target, but may require several shots.
Enhanced ammo that inflicts poison. Some targets require multiple shots.
Paralyzes target, but may require several shots.
Enhanced ammo that inflicts paralysis. Some targets require multiple shots.
Induces sleep, but may require several shots.
Enhanced ammo that inflicts sleep. Some targets require multiple shots.
Ammo that drains a monster's stamina.
Enhanced special ammo that drains a monster's stamina.
Ammo that restores a small amount of health to an ally upon impact.
Ammo that restores a moderate amount of health to an ally upon impact.
Ammo that fills the target with savage amounts of strength.
Ammo that makes the target's skin as hard as stone.
Bowgun ammo used to capture monsters ensnared in traps.
A regular old empty phial. Nothing more, nothing less.
An arrow coating that increases the attack power of arrows.
An arrow coating that applies poison effects to arrows.
An arrow coating that applies paralysis effects to arrows.
An arrow coating that applies sleep effects to arrows.
An arrow coating that applies explosive powder to arrows.
Arrows that deal more damage to close targets, but reduces maximum range.
An arrow coating that applies a fatigue-inducing fluid to arrows.
Restores a small amount of health. (Supply Item)
Restores a moderate amount of health. (Supply Item)
Fully restores health. (Supply Item)
Restores a small amount of stamina. (Supply Item)
Produces a cloud that heals you and anyone nearby. (Supply Item)
Produces a cloud that restores a large amount of health for you and anyone nearby. (Supply Item)
Cures poison and restores a bit of health for everyone nearby. (Supply Item)
Temporarily strengthens attacks for everyone nearby. (Supply Item)
Temporarily increases defense for everyone nearby. (Supply Item)
Favored by the Flooded Forest Giganha. Used to attract hordes. (Supply Item)
A powered-up large barrel bomb. As powerful as a mega barrel bomb. (Supply Item)
Activates a pitfall to catch monsters with. (Supply Item)
Immobilizes a target for easy capture. (Supply Item)
A bomb that flashes brightly on impact. (Supply Item)
Emits a high-frequency blast of sound on detonation. (Supply Item)
A particularly odorous ball that causes monsters to flee. (Supply Item)
Transports you to the nearest camp in an instant. (Supply Item)
A bomb used to capture monsters ensnared in traps. (Supply Item)
A throwing kunai with a venom-coated blade. Poisons targets. (Supply Item)
A throwing kunai coated with toxins that paralyze a target. (Supply Item)
A throwing kunai that has been dusted with sleeping agents. (Supply Item)
A massive fruit that restores health when eaten. Removed post-quest since it spoils.
Fruit that turns poisonous when it decomposes. Too dangerous to keep after a quest.
Fruit with an aroma so spicy it's paralyzing. Too dangerous to keep after a quest.
Fruit that pops with a bright flash if shaken. Too dangerous to keep after a quest.
Seeds from a monster, soaked in explosive oil. Too dangerous to keep after a quest.
Seeds from a monster, soaked in explosive oil. Too dangerous to keep after a quest.
Seeds from a monster, soaked with water. Too dangerous to keep after a quest.
Seeds from a monster, buzzing with electricity. Too dangerous to keep after a quest.
Seeds from a monster, chilled with cold air. Too dangerous to keep after a quest.
Kunai slathered in explosive gray seed oil. Too dangerous to keep after a quest.
A highly potent crimson seed barrel bomb. Too dangerous to keep after a quest.
A water-scattering blue seed barrel bomb. Too dangerous to keep after a quest.
An electrifying gold seed barrel bomb. Too dangerous to keep after a quest.
A freezing silver seed barrel bomb. Too dangerous to keep after a quest.
A heaping mushroom platter. Made with shrooms of all types and sizes.
A random assortment of mushrooms—some deadly, some valuable.
A plant that looks to the heavens when it blooms. Its petals are used to make dye.
A stargazer flower in full bloom. Its dignified display outshines the starry sky.
Found long ago in the tomb of a king from a long- forgotten desert land.
A burial cloth said to have shrouded an ancient desert king. Believed to be cursed.
A trendy orange pumpkin. If left undisturbed, it can grow to be gigantic.
Bumblepumpkins that grow to be this gigantic are referred to as "Omegakins."
A jellyfish with a uniquely cute pattern. Looks fluffy, but don't touch it.
A gothic-looking jellyfish with the same unique pattern, but more frills.
